differentialShannon

public static double differentialShannon(int[] counts1,
                                         int[] counts2,
                                         int n,
                                         int countsSum1,
                                         int countsSum2)
Computes differential shannon entropy

Returns:
DSE=SE(AB)-0.5*[SE(A)+SE(B)]

Parameters:
a - a double

getCorrelationCoefficient

public static double getCorrelationCoefficient(double[] array1,
                                               double[] array2)
Returns the correlation coefficient r^2. Correlation ("Statistik", 7 Aufl., Hartung, 1989, Kapitel 9 und 10, S.546-608): a=yMess[i]; b=yWahr[i]; aa=a*a; bb=b*b; ab=a*b; numerator=sumAB-(sumA*sumB/n); denominator=sqrt[(sumAA-(sumA*sumA/n))*(sumBB-(sumB*sumB/n))]; R=correlationcoefficient=numerator/denominator;

Author:
  • Joerg Kurt Wegner

info

public static double info(int[] counts)
Computes entropy for an array of integers.

Parameters:
counts - array of counts
Returns:
- a log2 a - b log2 b - c log2 c + (a+b+c) log2 (a+b+c) when given array [a b c]

Computes shannon entropy for an array of integers.

Parameters:
counts - array of counts
Returns:
- a log2 a - b log2 b - c log2 c when given array [a b c]

Returns c*log2(c) for a given integer value c.

Parameters:

Returns:
c*log2(c) (but is careful to return 0 if c is 0)
